name: Lost in London: adventures in the city's wild outdoors
description:
As well as our regular magazine, Lost in London is now available as a beautiful, hardback book. 

Packed full of fresh content, Lost in London: adventures in the city’s wild outdoors is a journey through the capital’s natural landscapes. 
A mix of all new inspiring tales and practical ideas, it’s perfect for those who like to wander in the woods, meander down the thames, and occasionally have a good old read over a cup of tea. 

Come, join us in celebrating the green between the grey.

name: Issue nine
description:
In issue 9 we meet South Kensington's resident sheep, explore the workings of Brixton's historic windmill, get up close and personal with the city's lichens, and meet the people trying to save a rare native wildflower from extinction. And all this over a cocktail or two, made from local London produce.

For all this and more, buy your copy now.



UK shipping only available from this site. Please contact us directly for international shipping
tina@lostinlondonmagazine.com

name: Issue 8 - Winter 2012-13
description: Just in time for christmas, this issue of Lost in London contains all the motivation you need to wrap up warm, get outdoors, and experience something new right on your doorstep. Join us as we herd cattle in Epping Forest, print our own christmas cards over a crafty pint, go in search of London's elusive owls and tuck in to a hearty meal of Brixton produce. UK shipping only available from this site. Please contact us directly for international shipping tina@lostinlondonmagazine.com Subscribe to our newsletter

name: Issue seven - Summer 2012
description: Our summer issue takes 'plot to plate' as inspiration, and traces the best community gardens projects in the city. You'll also find features of foraging and fashion in Hackney, blacksmithery in Rotherhithe, the hidden delights of Regent's Canal, as well as a run down of the best wildflower meadows to visit and how to make your own too. It's everything you need for living simply in the city this summer. Subscribe to our newsletter UK shipping only available from this site. Please contact us directly for international shipping tina@lostinlondonmagazine.com

name: Issue Six - Spring 2012
description: Our theme this season is trees in the city, and in this edition we've got tips on caring for street trees, news of an amazing project to re-establish elms in the city, and an interview with British sculptor David Nash - who resurrects dying trees into living art - as he embarks on a major residence at Kew Gardens. You'll also find ideas for spring floral displays, advice on how to make your own Easter eggs, and an exclusive on the London Bike Kitchen - a shop where you can learn to fix your own bicycle - as it opens its doors for the first time. We take orders to the post office once a week, so please allow a few days for delivery. If you're in an urgent hurry drop us an email, and we'll try and get it to you sooner. Many thanks! Subscribe to our newsletter

name: Issue Four - Autumn 2011
description:
This season, we bring you London's hidden pleasures - green havens in the Square Mile, snug teahouses for boardgames and books, and where to look for wildlife in the city's parklands. 

Plus:
recipes for creating the perfect Bonfire Night picnic and toasty tipples 
crafty projects for the home - from knitting to quilting
features covering a M25 vineyard and green roofing in the city
and our tips on getting the best out of the season


We take orders to the post office once a week, so please allow a few days for delivery. If you're in an urgent hurry drop us an email, and we'll try and get it to you sooner. Many thanks!

name: Issue Three - Summer 2011
description:
In this issue, we show you the wild side of our capital: from the best outdoor swimming spots and rustic campsites to London's most unusual secret gardens. There are also tips on how to attract the city's butterflies to your own backyard, make you own BBQ treats, allotment keeping for novices as well as our guide on where to spot some of Britain's most spectacular dragonflies.

name: Issue Two - Spring 2011
description:
For everything you need to know about living simply in the city this season, don't miss the spring issue of Lost in London; over one hundred beautifully illustrated pages packed with ideas on how to find the country life in London. 
 
Discover London's best spots for spring flowers and wildlife, how to create you own roof garden as well as outdoor activities to blow away the cobwebs of winter. You will also find tips on craft in the home, seasonal recipes and where to forage for the city's own grown produce. 


UK shipping only available from this site. Please contact us directly for international shipping

name: Issue One – Autumn / Winter 2010
description:
“Now is all about thick winter coats, beautiful woollens, ski socks, soup, old man pubs and open fires.” Autumn-Winter 2010 edition

In this issue find ideas, tips and inspiration about how to enjoy the best the city has to offer this season, including;

    * Ideas for winter walks and where to look for London’s wildlife
    * Advice on where to forage for mushrooms in the city’s woodlands
    * Learn about keeping bees in the city as we follow a new generation of urban beekeepers
    * Find out what to grow on your balcony or small garden this season
    * Read about London’s most peaceful hangouts for wintry Sunday afternoons
    * Ideas for seasonal recipes sourced from the city’s best-kept culinary secrets


UK shipping only available from this site. Please contact us directly for international shipping
